meanings.definition: A word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: I created an anagram of the word 'listen' and got 'silent'.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys solving anagrams in the newspaper puzzle section.
meanings.sent3: The anagram 'debit card' can be rearranged to spell 'bad credit'.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players compete to quickly solve anagrams to win points.
meanings.sent5: The anagram 'astronomer' can be rearranged to spell 'moon starer'.

meanings.definition: To rearrange the letters of a word or phrase to form a new word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: He likes to anagram his name to come up with cool nicknames.
meanings.sent2: They decided to anagram the secret message for fun.
meanings.sent3: She anagrammed the word 'listen' and was surprised to get 'silent'.
meanings.sent4: The poet anagrams words to find new inspiration for his verses.
meanings.sent5: You can anagram 'triangle' to spell 'integral' with the same letters.
